oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Collecting taxes, "In his Majesties Name."
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jonathan Putnam, constable, is directed to collect taxes, "In his Majesties Name." The document also details the consequences for individuals who are unable or unwilling to pay.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Taxes
Taxation; Tax collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: By 1765, the Stamp Act Congress was declared. The Stamp Act stated that taxes could be imposed only by the elected officials of the colonies and that the distance between Britain and North America precluded colonial representation in Parliament.
